docs.lead_paragraph: Updated: The House voted 240 to 194 in favor of a restrictive abortion amendment that signaled a shift in the political center on abortion rights. Opponents of the measure -- including many Democratic female lawmakers -- called it the most regressive provision on the issue of reproductive rights since the Henry Hyde amendment.
docs.abstract: House Democrats -- including top female lawmakers -- denounced a restrictive amendment on abortion that had been brokered so that conservative Democrats might support the House health care bill.
docs.snippet: House Democrats -- including top female lawmakers -- denounced a restrictive amendment on abortion that had been brokered so that conservative Democrats might support the House health care bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: No matter what Congress does with health care legislation in the next few weeks, one thing is already clear: the result will not do much to control the climbing costs of medical care in the United States.
docs.abstract: No matter what Congress does with health care legislation in the next few weeks, one thing is already clear: the result will not do much to control the climbing costs of medical care in the United States. And that is why many employers and insurance companies may seek savings by encouraging patients to travel abroad for treatment.
docs.snippet: No matter what Congress does with health care legislation in the next few weeks, one thing is already clear: the result will not do much to control the climbing costs of medical care in the United States. And that is why many employers and insurance...

docs.lead_paragraph: Some lawmakers today used live props - infants and young children - to help make their arguments about health care as they take to the House floor on Saturday. As they did so, they were chastised by those presiding over the debate.
docs.abstract: In one of the stranger moments of the health care debate, Rep. John Shadegg channels a toddler's health care musings on the floor of the House.
docs.snippet: In one of the stranger moments of the health care debate, Rep. John Shadegg channels a toddler's health care musings on the floor of the House.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the House began debate on President Obama's top-priority initiative to overhaul the health care system, protesters outside the Capitol occasionally yelled or waved signs that said, "Have you heard us yet?"
docs.abstract: Outside the House, a different type of debate raged about the health care legislation, with protesters waving signs and shouting, "Kill the bill!"
docs.snippet: Outside the House, a different type of debate raged about the health care legislation, with protesters waving signs and shouting, "Kill the bill!"

docs.lead_paragraph: Update | 1:45 p.m. President Obama made a last-minute appeal to Congress on Saturday, urging lawmakers to "answer the call of history'' by casting their votes in favor of a health overhaul being considered on the floor of the House of Representatives.
docs.abstract: The president visited Capitol Hill to help sway undecided House Democrats on health care.
docs.snippet: The president visited Capitol Hill to help sway undecided House Democrats on health care.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated After months of work by Congressional Democrats on major health care legislation, the floor debate on the bill was at risk of being overshadowed on Saturday by a fierce internal dispute among Democrats over the issue of insurance coverage for abortions.

headline.main: Abortion Fight Erupts in Health Care Debate

docs.abstract: Stay with us throughout the day as we file updates to the floor debate in the House of Representatives.
docs.snippet: Stay with us throughout the day as we file updates to the floor debate in the House of Representatives.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama uses his weekly address this week to express sympathy for those who lost loved ones at the Fort Hood shooting and also to hail the valor of those on the scene.

headline.main: Saturday Word: Fort Hood and Health Care

docs.abstract: With a House health care vote looming, President Obama discusses the Fort Hood tragedy in his weekly address.
docs.snippet: With a House health care vote looming, President Obama discusses the Fort Hood tragedy in his weekly address.

headline.main: The World’s Best Health Care System?
headline.print_headline: The World’s Best Health Care System?

docs.lead_paragraph: If the House health care vote happens this weekend, perhaps you will want to flip back and forth between the football games.
docs.snippet: If the House health care vote happens this weekend, perhaps you will want to flip back and forth between the football games.
